***DISCLAIMER*** I worked at a McDonald's when I was in high school back in the late 70s. You know, back in the days before computers told you what change you owed back to the customer. The days when you actually had to have simple money handling skills and count the customer's change back to them. Putting a food order together wasn't rocket science back then and because computers now do the work for the employees, it's even easier to do today. However, you have to be careful to check your order with this McD's as more often times then not your order is wrong or worst, the food has been sitting under the heating lamp way too long and should've been tossed. Today I ordered a large coffee with my sausage mcmuffin and (luke warm) hash brown. Imagine my surprise when taking the last drink of my coffee I got a mouth full of coffee grinds. McD's needs to take a page out of the In-N-Out playbook. In-N-Out is ALWAYS fresh, and they ALWAYS get your order right.

"Signature Crafted Recipe" Burger leaves unintended impressions:  I saved up some calories to spend on McDonald's new signature burgers today. Yeah, I even ate the bun. I found the burger dull, poorly made, overpriced and not fresh. There was no 'craft' in the "Crafted." Just the burger and the large fries was over $9.00!  For those of you moaning about Steak 'n Shake, the McDonald's burger is much worse.  Although I thought the 'artisan bun' was good, it was not heated and caramelized on the grill like a good burger should be. This burger had no texture, the meat was dry and tasted like it had been overcooking in a drawer for hours. The cheese was too thin to taste, as was the bacon (not thick or even crispy). The assembly was too rushed and the sauce was a little dot in the middle of a bun. I HATE that and sent it back with the specifics I had asked for in the original order.  I knew that the burger would be terrible going in. I know they're trying but the execution and controls just aren't there. If your people can't even spread the condiments over the face of the bun, Step #1, Step #2 is going to be subpar too.  How hard is it to spread some sauce out on the buns, guys?  Although some folks might like that they're now bringing it to your table, I don't. Partly because I knew the order would be wrong, but also because it was just more efficient to have it handed to me and check. I'm also, go figure, one of these people who hates wasting things, even little things. I saw that the employees taking the food out were just assuming folks wanted ketchup and putting a hand full on the tray. I didn't want any and it's just more work touching stuff to bring it back to the counter instead of throwing it in the trash. None of this was upsetting. I knew going in...  Really, I even feel guilty taking all the packaging that comes with a meal at McDonald's. Those trash cans fill up FAST with one use only items that are just added to the customer's bill. It feels irresponsible. Excess packaging and boxes never makes burgers better. Having the food brought to the table is just problematic and this aspect of the hospitality didn't seem to be working. Observing the action in the restaurant, it seems that many trays being delivered were missing something and then required the employee to run around even more. How much easier it is just to wait by the counter and get what you need and check the order.  The bottom line is this, if you can't get the small stuff right, it's a mistake to add more and more to the menu. It just brings the quality down even further. I know it's counterintuitive but that was the reality here, poorly trained and poorly supervised kitchen people putting out poorly assembled food past its prime. What should have been a pretty simple burger, easily made, becomes a bum meal, a hassle and you're charged over $9.00 for it.  Lesson learned (glancing back to Steak n' Shake ((before quickly remembering Flame It!))! 'Flame It' nails all the negatives pointed out in this review and does it for 3-4 dollars less! Also Retro Junction! Now them is some burgers!  I hope this feedback is helpful,  -G

This is my favorite McDonalds if I'm ever in town. I love coming here, and will be coming here again in the future for any business trips in the area.

Boo! Hiss!  Dried out sirloin burger with paper think bacon portioned out from the inside of a fingernail. Lacking taste and texture, why do I ever keep trying their new menu items? The burger I received was not plump and in fact was a squat puck or disk with no rounded quality as shown in the picture.  Squirty condiments that are blobbed on will never create the flavor and tongue feel of mayo, mustard and ketchup that is spread out over the entire surface of the bun. You will always get 'sections' of condiments in some areas and nothing in others.  As I've said before, I NEVER get the fries unless the oil is freshly changed and the color is very light. This works out well for me since the oil is normally old and broken down creating a fry with bad texture and a terrible after taste that creeps up on you.  Read: I don't get them often!  It's a fools game wishing that things would be improved with the burgers here.   If your expectations are low, you'll be well served here.  -G

Learn to listen people!

The cashiers were really friendly and had water cups ready on a hot day. Not too many seats inside though.

I hate to give this place such a low rating because the food is actually good. I give this low rating because it is not safe to eat inside any more. The patron they beat on was injured and had his face all bloody, and his radio broken and property scattered all over the floor. So if you decide to eat here, take your food and run.

They seem to do a 2-star job here. Despite being too salty, the biscuits and gravy is delicious. I'd be happy if they just held the biscuits and gave me a bucket of the gravy!  Unless the fries have freshly changed oil used to cook them, they taste awful and leave a lingering aftertaste. In an unlikely form of gratitude, this keeps me from eating them but a few times a year since you can tell just by watching them come out (by the color) whether or not the oil is fresh. It also bugs me that when you do buy a large, it's almost $3.00 and the sleeve isn't filled like it should be.  When the stars do align, I've been known to just buy 2 large to get my 'fry on.' Really not much else on the menu is very good. Inferior burgers relying largely on the cheap bun for bulk. That always goes in the trash...  I loath the use of their lettuce which offers NO texture or flavor and is only there because it won't go brown after sitting for days. It's so thin and essentially useless in adding interest, texture or flavor.  The breakfast burritos are a joke, rubber-like. Thing is, any of this garbage fills your stomach. But by that reasoning, so would a piece of tanbark, which would be far more healthy.  I must say, I have enjoyed the sausage mc muffins. Despite being far too salty, when cooked fresh, they're great. I love the slight spice. Love that slight char of the English muffin texture with butter and then the meat.... I never add egg here since it's overcooked and too much like rubber.  The smartest thing this company did was in deciding to use real butter again. Mc Duh!  Interestingly, their restaurants in Europe use far better quality overall. People there wouldn't buy it otherwise since they're entirely more attuned to quality in their food. The bread/buns are substantially better quality (choose your type) and you can get blue cheese, emmental, Gruyere, etc. Some of those locations are two stories and they're tech marvels. At the Louvre in Paris, they have kiosks where you tap in your order and pay, all without using a cashier or getting in a line (if you want). Then you just pick your food up at the window. Eating quality McDonalds a few stories underground, 20ft away from an underground 12th century French castle/fortress, and a palace built in the 1500's above you was surreal. The restaurants are marvels of cutting edge design, interior and exteriors unlike anything seen in our area.   On the other hand, I hated their fries which were more Belgian-like.  In conclusion, McDonalds, please to change your oil. It's almost certainly past the due date.  -G

Sharing my experience today, 7/18/14 at 11:4 5am.  I took my 5 year old to redeem his free cone for signing up for a library card and reading his 2 books in the summer reading program.  We also chose today as a reward after finishing his swim lessons.  We told the cashier in the drive through what we were doing and he said to come to the window.  When we got there, he called the manager to look at this Free cone card, signed by the Fresno County Public Library.  The manager then told us that they won't give us the cone. Just the review of my experience.  It was sad for us, but thought I'd let everyone know that this independently owned franchisee doesn't participate in the FRESNO COUNTY reading program.  So, instead of buying my son his $1.00 cone there, we drove to the next one and bought my daughters happy meal and my coffee and turned the card in there.  But thought I'd save y'all a trip before the manager sends your kid away from their $1.00 cone redemption.
